They've only gotten louder since I've stayed. Pounding, driving. A couple of times I blacked out. It was...
By the fires of Red Mountain!
Let's have a closer look at these runes.
In fact, if I'm reading this correctly, it says that Miraak was a traitor. Most interesting.
Takes money to make money, all that rot. There's a lot of it at the other end, but I can't get there without a little kick to start it off.
I could have sworn...oh well.
Take your time. I shall follow when you are ready.
For returning my mother's necklace, you have my gratitude. It means more to me than you can know.
Who knows what dangers await us in this place.
Back to the adventure!
You cross the Thalmor, you pay the price.
It's no secret to me that Frea hesitates. Her path is not clear.
Ah, so you aren't just another wandering vagrant with a pocket full of stories. Apologies. That changes things.
Morvayn will pay for this!
What? No! You can't... I have his will on my side! He will command all of us!
I'm the last one. The others are all dead now.
I may sound like a crazy old man to you, but I'm telling you, the tunnels here are solid... they would never collapse like that.
I've been trained by the Tong, fool!
So gaining the favor of a Telvanni wizard isn't enough?
What do you think you're doing?
Miraak was a formidable opponent. I wonder what he would have been like as my apprentice.
This fire seems significant. I'm sure it's important for some reason.
Dwemer mechanisms have no sense of self preservation.
Thirsk didn't always make its own mead. No, we used to get by on shipments from Skyrim.
In deep.
Miraak has commanded your death. So it shall be.
You'll stay away from this cabin if you know what's good for you.
I promise that any unrelated memories I run across will be kept in the strictest of confidences.
Enemies of the Empire will fall!
No, please! I don't want to die!
What? Are you... are you serious? Well, I think I could make that work..
These runes have faded a bit, but I believe I can translate the inscription.
Thought you could hide, eh?
I think we're almost to the bottom of the Barrow, but... it's going to be everything I can do to find more miners.
...I've almost got enough... just need one good haul...
I'll head out looking for her eventually. We'll wander the wilderness together. Just have to get some things in order here, first.
He has returned to the All-Maker. He is at peace now, no matter what that evil thing may have done to his body.
She was hurt so bad. We took pity on her and nursed her back to health.
What a waste of a good specimen.
Well. Nobody is here now.
Watch where you're going.
I'll kill you for this!
..."he's got your eyes," she says... lyin' tramp...
I'd better check on Ulves. The kitchen supplies were getting low.
These platforms are definitely moving more quickly. Can you keep up with them?
Must have scared them away.
Leave, or I'll be forced to show you the true power of a Telvanni wizard.

Should have known better than to challenge a master wizard of the House Telvanni.
Let me see that.
He draws near.
Oh... I was hoping I wouldn't see you quite so soon.
You will die. And with the power of your soul, I will return to Solstheim and be master of my own fate once again.
They would hunt, they would fight, and the mightiest among them would rise up as leader.

Time to die, outlander!
Stop that!
This writing refers to a guardian who inspired both men and dragons.
Move along. There's nothing for you here.
Unless you're looking for a fight, you'd best walk away.
You are alive only at my pleasure. Do not forget that.
You can only hide so long.
Please, leave us. We must concentrate.
I'm going to put this memory trace spell on you, so you won't have to worry about taking notes. I doubt you could know what was important anyway.
Fascinating. I hope one of you dies.
Sahrotaar, are you so easily swayed?
...told him to just hand it over, but did he listen? Oh, no... he had to fight back...
To Nchardak, then. Follow me.
Have you tried to walk on the plates without stepping on the same one twice?
What happened?
Morvayn's reign is over!
Crescius is convinced it's a story cooked up by the company to cover up something else, but I don't know.
Fascinating.
Unlock the door! Hurry!
Please, I don't wish to be disturbed while I'm meditating.
I'm not even sure... I can picture a temple, here on Solstheim. Must've been a bad dream.
I'll spit you in two!
(Failed) Don't insult me. You don't have nearly enough for this to be worth my time, or yours.

Damnable ash! No matter how much I wash the food, it still gets in it.
The secrets. They're in my head. Can't get them out.
I'm gonna bleed you!

When the tide goes, we'll go with it.
Rieklings. You must have passed by the hall on your way down here? Well, it's been overrun.
Hmm. Nothing, I guess.
I make it. I drink it. I share it with friends. Ha!
And you... step forward.

My father Storn, the shaman, protects them in the village.
Good idea. They might leak out. Don't want them crawling into your head, too. Like me. They're in my head. Right now. Saying things.
Turn around and walk away.

Clumsy oaf!
You're treading on Imperial soil! Prepare to defend yourself!
I had my suspicions that he was undead. How else could he have survived for over 200 years?

Although... maybe this could solve two problems...
I never get tired of that sound. It'll take me a few days to dig up some more laborers, but swing back when you get a chance. See how we're doing.
Go. My father sacrificed himself so that you could destroy Miraak and lift his master's shadow from the land.
I'll go to Raven Rock and you... you won't mention this to anyone. If you see me there, just... give a nod and I'll lend a hand if you need it.
But we let that sweet life get the better of us. We grew soft, and...

Councilor Morvayn told me to give this to you if you made it back in one piece... and you got rid of General Carius.

The Skaal will one day look to Frea. I hope she will be there for them.
Fear my power!
They're stuck in there.
Yikes! All yours, my friend!

Your armor will look good on me.
Kuvar. He thinks we've all gotten a little too soft. I can see what he means looking at Elmus, but the rest of us still have our edge.
Perhaps something is meant to go into the fire. But what could it be? Something that's already nearby, perhaps?
Those of us that didn't die were made prisoners.
That foolish old man thinks he's thirty years younger than he is. He's going to get himself killed traipsing around the mine.
Good luck to you.
I'm glad these platforms appear once you finish them. I don't want to find out what's down in that water.
Was that really necessary?
Do something!
Poor man... can you imagine doing all that dangerous work just to end up dying at your own doorstep?

It took courage to rescue me from the elves, and I thank you for that.
What faithless minds have stolen.
...just one more bottle... maybe a second one to get to sleep...
Get out of here before I toss you out.
I've...failed...

Perhaps I'll be the first Skaal to slay a dragon. That would be worthy of a tale!
By the All-Maker, yes! That is the very one! I can only assume you took this from Ancarion's corpse.
Go rip that thrice cursed heart stone from her chest.
"... but I can get it." Sure, sure. Listen, I've heard this song before and I'm already tired of it. Come back when you're not a waste of my time.
I have learned some of what he knows, but it is not my place to divulge anything to an outsider.
We must look to the All-Maker for guidance in these dark times.
What do you have for me?
I admire the Dwemer skill but it can get tiresome.
Off you go. If you discover any side effects, come back and tell me straight away.
Unless you have more Stalhrim weapons and armor for me, we have nothing to talk about.

I do my best to counsel my people, but I cannot allay their fears.
Did you find any evidence at Severin Manor yet?
I shall look around. We can proceed when you are ready.
I'll crush the life from you!
Yes, yes. You're Dragonborn. We're all very impressed.

Stay out of our way, or I promise you'll regret it.
A long time ago, a man named Hrothmund left the Skaal to form his own tradition.
Let's have a closer look at these runes.
It's too dangerous out here. We can't waste time worrying about having a liar in our midst. Lying is the first step to cowardice, after all.
Ah...damn you!
I command powers you can only dream of!

I'll kill whoever I must, but I will see my plans fulfilled!

Here we reclaim.
Hmm. I expected you to die. Oh, well.
You'll pay for that!

A werewolf? Here?
May he be rewarded for his service as I am!
I hope you gave him a swift end.
But those days are behind us, now.
You won't feel a thing. But if you do, try not to scream too loudly. My ears are sensitive.
Aha! Here's another of those dragon language inscriptions! I wonder what it says.
If there's anything at all I can do to help, please let me know.
There's a lot of work to do, still, getting this place back up and running.
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Fire, storm and ice!
Hmm...looks like it needs some sort of key. Maybe those half claws you found would fit in here if you put them together?
Hey! We got a deader over here!
She's always been quick to shame.
He was an explorer for the East Empire Company. They'd send him all over Tamriel when they had difficulties in a mining operation.
...damn wizards... not good enough for yer precious college, eh?
I do not know what it is Miraak learned that gave him reason to turn on his masters.
It cannot be much farther now. I feel it in my bones.
I think he knew what would happen. He saw his death in that book.
Do you have a death wish?
There are other stones around Solstheim. I fear for what has happened to them...
What...? Whoever did this is dead. You hear me? Dead!
Leave me to mourn my father. I have no more words for you now.
Another one for the scrap heap of history.
You have the heart of a great bear, as well as a wolf's cunning.
I do not blame you. I know he chose this. I just wish he had seen another way.
Don't worry, most people can't tell we're related.
Redoran-following dog!
All he wanted me to do is track you down and send you to him.
Do not speak. Focus is essential, or else the barrier may fall.

Impossible. There must be something more! Look around.
Ready to do more business?

He was the first great Nord enchanter, maybe even the first human to master elven methods.
Uh... yeah. That sounds good. Half. I think that will work.
You've proven devastating to their plans and they'd stop at nothing to hunt you down.

Enough for now. But I'll either need to get some more barrels or start importing more if we're going to make it through next winter.
I have friends in Raven Rock, and a few among the Skaal. There's not much metal on the island itself, but we can find what we need, when we need it.
Ahh!
It's a shame. There are quite a few tales of General Carius's exploits, including the founding of Raven Rock.
Be silent.
It's a lot of nonsense to me, but they seem to get by.
Nothing I can't handle!

Interesting. This may be worth exploring.
It's going to hit three thousand this time, I'm afraid. Have you got that on you?
Aggghh!

Repel the invader!
So you chose to day to die...

If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.
Gratian Caerellius.
...should have known she wouldn't wait for me... I'll gut that filthy farmer when I see him...
What news do you bring from Fort Frostmoth?

There was a horrible accident, and he was killed when one of the tunnels collapsed.
I love him dearly, and I support everything he does, but I can't let him chase this silly idea or he may end up joining Gratian in a rocky grave.
My beloved is almost eighty years old and I think the shock of finding one of his ancestor's things has left his mind a bit... confused.

I have been taken against my will! I am in need of rescue!
I suppose I'll have to pay you.
Unless you have more Stalhrim weapons and armor for me, we have nothing to talk about.

There is more coin if you wish to claim it. You know what I want.

Kruziikrel! Relonikiv! Now!

For House Hlaalu!
This is most exciting, wouldn't you agree?
Beware. Miraak is strong. He knew you would come here.

Hmm... it's all here. Well, then... looks like I have a good bit of work to start on.

Every time the Red Mountain belches, more of them land here. Look around for impact craters, exposed rock, that sort of thing.
Did you really think our threats were idle?
Please! You've got to get me out of here before she comes back.
Better than a soldier's pay, so you should be thankful.
I am their master!
No one can take them away. No one!
Maybe I can find more of them. More spiders!
Their mine. The spiders are mine to control!
Why did he have to call me insane?
Who are you? Have you come to take them away?
No doubt just as Hermaeus Mora intended. He is a fickle master, you know.
And so the First Dragonborn meets the Last Dragonborn at the summit of Apocrypha.
But now I will be free of him. My time in Apocrypha is over. You are here in your full power, and thus subject to my full power.

I've just the spell for you!

Be careful, if the Severin's have betrayed us, then they'll be well-armed.

Please, tell Storn what has happened.
Watch out! We have company!
This is what I hired you for!

Those boots'll look mighty fine on me.
I hope Geldis proved useful. Have you made any progress?

I believe Councilor Morvayn wants to speak to you.
For Vilur Ulen! Long live House Hlaalu!

I'll spill your blood, fetcher!

For Vilur Ulen!

That's that.
You've earned your citizenship here, and I hope you'll consider staying with us as a member of our community.
I am not going down there. It would be foolish to attempt it.
You have a much better chance than I to make it through these traps.

In fact, they've been very accommodating. Hospitable, even. They seem happy to talk about their traditions and history.
You fight valiantly against fate, but I am stronger here.
How can I serve you, thuri?
And there is the one who has freed us.
This is the only way, Dragonborn. The only way I can be free.
Yes, that was a most disturbing experience. But to answer your question, the architecture was strange, almost otherworldly.
Felling Alduin was a mighty deed, and I thank you for it. He would have proved troublesome to me.
Well you know it as well as I do. Raven Rock Mine wasn't empty at all... it's still rich in ebony ore.
Fool tribe-kin, chase away. Bilgemuck fear.
Then I'll settle down peacefully and never set foot in this mine again.
Drovas! I need you to clean the rooms again. I went through there, and there's ash everywhere.
Until I met my darling Aphia, yes.
I can tell you don't like me. Well guess what. I don't give a damn.
I wanted her to see her homeland before she died.
Some dark influence wields power over them, forces them to forget themselves and act against their nature.
My strength falters. We do not have much time.
Either that, or perhaps a daedra. If so, then may the nine protect us.
It is good to see you again.
I don't know you, and the last thing I want is a stranger with her nose in my business. Go away.
Surprised you've never heard of it.
Be strong. Fight big ones.
He noticed the shadowmarks like you did, and I thought he was one of us.
A fellow Breton who went by the name Esmond Tyne showed up on my doorstep about a fortnight ago.
It would seem so. And you are to thank for it.
I don't know you, and the last thing I want is a stranger with his nose in my business. Go away.
You could have been mighty, if fate had decreed otherwise.
I always knew you were weak-minded, Sahrotaar.
Redgrass?
Ahmik oblaan. My service to you is over.
Where beast? See you, no see Bilgemuck. Go, go!
I can't thank you enough for setting me up as steward of Tel Mithryn.
I told him not to head up there. Sounds like the bloody fool got what he deserved.
Good to hear.
I thought you were stronger than this, Kruziikrel.
I don't mind working at the Retching Netch, but I was hoping for a bit more when I moved to Solstheim. Ah well.
Zu'u ni zaamiil. You cannot command me forever.
I suppose you could have called me a bitter old hermit... now I'm just old.
There's got to be more to life than sweeping and cleaning all day.
Good luck. Maybe you can figure out what's going on around here.
That he did. Right out from under my nose. Can you believe it?
I've been waiting for this moment for a long time... even before I discovered Gratian's old things.
If anyone can help us now, it is you.
It's my own formula for improved bonemold. Took me years to perfect.
I told him he was crazy to even think about talking to those vicious little buggers, but he wouldn't listen.
You've gone far enough. Neloth is a fool to think he could send some low life to finish me off.
Anyway, I suppose you're looking for work. Well, I've got bad news. This place is dryer than a damn bone.
Look, we've been over this. I paid you off, I don't owe you a thing.
We ran out of jazbay berries almost two weeks ago.
Yes, boss.
Mogrul, I thought I told you I didn't want you hanging around here.
If you ask me, I can't blame them. Things aren't what they used to be out there.
I might lend coin to people that need it, but I never lend to strangers. So shove off.
Yeah, I heard you before. I just don't care. You won't kick me out of here, and we both know it.
I'm not asking you if I can stay, I'm telling you. Now that's the end of it.
Eager to make some coin, eh? That's the spirit.
The Greybeards taught you well.
People don't usually sail over there unless they have a particular reason. It can be a pretty rough place.
It's an island northeast of here. Has a small dark elf town called Raven Rock and a handful of Nords living in Skaal Village.
And besides, it's really my problem anyway. I caused it.
Fate decreed that you had to die so that I could win my freedom.
Stab and run! The tribe-kin way.
Well, well. It's been a long time since someone from the Guild's bothered to make their way out here.
All-Maker bless you, friend of the Skaal.
Thank you, outsider.
You strong. Help tribe-kin.
At first it was only during the night, but now every moment is spent building some strange shrine around the Wind Stone.
So easily you betray me, after all these years.
Much of what was known has been lost to the ages. He was Dragonborn, and yet he served the Dragons.
We must tell Storn what we have seen.
Well, then you'll just have to clean them twice a day. Whatever it takes.
I'll give you a fair price. Not many people headed over there these days.
Welcome to the Retching Netch Cornerclub, milady. If you need anything, Master Geldis will be happy to help you.
Muwafathoo.
A strange thing, to lose control of oneself. We are lucky to be free.
Hermaeus Mora is laughing at us, you know.
I cannot maintain the barrier for much longer.
Given that, and the considerable power it must have taken to affect our minds so completely, it would suggest the work of a powerful mage.
Put an end to this evil magic before it consumes us all.
I only had enough coin saved to send one of us back to the Imperial City, so I sent my mother alone.
I came from three generations of miners, and I couldn't get anyone to believe me.
You do that, and I'll make sure you're set up right. You won't be disappointed.
Hrawwaaaa!
We already owe you much, but I must ask you for one more thing.

There comes a time when everything must change. Nothing that lives remains the same forever.

Still interested in heading over there?

Wundun oblaan. We have arrived.
Must've run off.
We're the victims of some evil magic, but why?
We get by trading odds and ends with the locals. I've decided to stay here and make sure she passes in peace. It's the least I can do for her.
Hyargh!
A fever must have taken me. What else could explain this?
The blacksmith up at Skaal Village seems to have gone missing and they've asked us to keep an eye out.
I pray to the All-Maker that whatever this was, it doesn't happen again.
I don't know who sent you here, but you've given us something to build on here. I hope someday we can repay you for your kindness.
Yes, thuri. Wah golt. I will land at once.
Wagh!
Your actions here have been a blessing to us all, serjo.
We are here. Wundun oblaan. How else can I serve you?
It's a shrine to... I don't remember. Isn't that strange?
As you wish.
What would you ask of me?

No one here now.

Please, stop!
Just got some of my merchandise off the latest supply ship. See if anything strikes your fancy.
Guess it was nothing.
Before he died, he told the Redoran Guard about the wreck and warned us that it was going to be crawling with reavers.
Nooo....
Mother used to get so worried when I walked too far from the village.
At once. Zu'u fen al.
Yes, yes, of course. Goodbye.
Abide by our laws, and we'll get along well.
Nahkriin fah zaamhus!
But you may be able to cleanse the other Stones. Even if this does not stop Miraak, it surely will delay his return.
Look out! Another Steam Centurion!
Aggh!
All-Maker shelter you.
The time has come.
If the quality's right, I'll take those off your hands. Let me take a look.
There you are!
Now we end this!
This is both fascinating and terrifying.
No need to be worried, I suppose.
Hhuurrrkh...
Show me you are the hero they say you are!
Rraaah!
Kill me already!
Not certain who lived there... it was already a pile of rubble when I arrived in Raven Rock.
I also remind the Skaal to live as one with nature and to honor the will of the All-Maker, so that we'll be worthy to join him in death.
Who are you? What am I doing here?
I know you're here.
Very well.
Gelfek.
Be welcome in our village.
Remember to hunt only when you have need.
Got the best merchandise on the island. Have a look for yourself.
As shaman of Skaal Village, I serve as both a guide and a healer, as well as a keeper of traditions.
I can feel it. The balance of the living land has nearly been restored.
Every once in a while a local makes it out here. Although, they usually just want to catch a glimpse of Dusty. Silt Striders are pretty rare now.
Strong steel guard you, friend.
Our traditions do not speak of them. But they and Miraak are connected. You read a Black Book, and saw him.
The land provides all that I need. I have no use for your coins.
Yuntar.
We Skaal are not like you. We do not seek adventure, we wish only to live in peace and to honor our traditions. I hope you understand.
You. Fol. Low. Me?
The blast from the volcano wiped most of them out.
You. Fol. Low. Me!
What would you like to know?
You will never enslave me again, Miraak.
We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.
That? It's... Well, it's a shrine for... something. I'm not sure what.
You are a true hero. I thank you, friend.
My road takes me home, outsider. Hunt well.
A Silt Strider carapace is so strong it can withstand the harshest of weather.
Mostly for transporting goods and people. They were pretty commonplace in Morrowind, but that was ages ago.
I must not fail my people.
Very well, you're free to go. Next time you might not be so lucky.
I will look for a spot to land.
All right.
From that look on your face I'm guessing you've never seen a Silt Strider before?
She hasn't been in traveling condition for quite a while now. I've tried to let her go off on her own but she insists on staying here.
You've got a good thing going here now that you've reopened the mines. Don't let it go to waste.
This is Dusty. I personally trained her from a larva. Feels like a lifetime ago now.
Good enough. I'll just remove any stolen goods on you, and then you're free to go.
I must get home, outsider.
Freeing the other Stones will diminish whatever dark influence is spreading across Solstheim.
Knew I'd find you!
(snort)
I have to get back home.
(snort)
The destruction of our homeland, the exile of our people and the rebuilding of our civilization.
Of course, when you reach my age, you'll find that the word "young" is a very relative term.
Oof!
Stop right there... where have I seen you before?
One moment... you look familiar.
Sorry friend, but I'm on the road home. Find me there and perhaps we can talk.
Very well, if you need my help, seek me out here in the village.
Nnnyyaarrgh!
I am sorry, but I must refuse. I am grateful for your help, but my place is here, with my people.
There's no mistake. You've committed crimes against the Dunmer people of Solstheim, and in the name of House Redoran it's time to face justice.
At last. Sovngarde...
As you command.
You've committed crimes against the Dunmer people of Solstheim. What say you in your defense?
I fashioned an amulet to guard me against whatever has taken hold of the Skaal, but it is the only one of its kind.
We must find out what is at work here.
What in the name of Azura...?
I will shadow your steps.
I heard crazy old Crescius has been sneaking into Raven Rock Mine again. At his age, he's going to get himself killed in there.
Enough!
Now, what can I do for young Morwen?
No more!
Ah, well, I suppose she'll always be that fiesty little girl I used to know.
I suppose I can overlook it for now, but you better keep your hands clean or I'll come after you again... you got that?
It's the capital of Morrowind... been that way ever since Mournhold was sacked by the Argonians.
Your Shout broke whatever evil will controlled the Stone, and restored its true nature as a conduit of the All-Maker's gifts.
As you command. Mu daal wah golt.
Right then! Off to the Bulwark with you.
Waaaaah!
I suppose I could dig up a staff or two for you.
Then in House Redoran's name, you'll get your wish!
If death is what you seek... I'll be happy to oblige!
All right, just keep it quiet. I warn you though, there's still a price on your head. Next guard you run into might not be so... agreeable.
Come out!
Forgive my impatience, but I must get back to the village right away.
A few months ago, I had sent an important folio to the First Edition Bookshop in the Imperial City to be rebound.
You saved us! But from what? Is it truly over?
Relief and gratitude
Even the legendary sandstorms of Vvardenfell's Molag Amur Region were said to barely make a dent in them. Of course, that's all ash now.
I don't know what spell you freed us from, outsider, but I thank you.
You out here for a reason?
What in Mundus am I doing out here at this hour?
I must have imagined it.
I'm on my way to Skaal Village. Perhaps I'll see you there.
Found Dusty here in a small cave on Vvardenfell. Silt Strider cocoons are pretty tough.
You have a companion already. You don't need my help.
Thu'um se Dovahkiin inhus, Miraak. Hin suleyksejun oblaan.
Please accept this as a token of gratitude. Once again, you've proven yourself an ally to the Skaal.
The whole village is here! What sorcery is this?
Men, an invader has entered the fort! Prepare yourselves for an ambush!
All-Maker bless you! You have saved us!
If you've got gold on your hands, you might talk to Ralis, up at Kolbjorn Barrow. I've heard he wants to excavate the place.
I can't speak now, friend. I must return home.
Because of you, my life has meaning again. Thank you!
The evil in this place must be rooted out.
Is this a dream? No, it is a nightmare, surely.
Be always warm, Skaal-friend.
I can't talk now. I must get back to the village.
Your ignorance of our homeland doesn't surprise me.
Very well.
Hrargh!
I don't visit there often anymore, but we still get the occasional supply ship and visitors from there.
I was here alone then, and I find an assistant is absolutely essential for this kind of dirty, dangerous work.
May the sun light your path.
I'll find you eventually.
Who were the perpetrators of those falsehoods?
Very good, Galdrus. Your lessons are going well. You may carry on.
Come, there looks to be a way out through here.
Unnff!
All-Maker... please...
Farewell, strong one.
Why was I building a temple?
He also is searching for them. In fact, he has already found one. He showed it to me when he came here.
The power of the Stone had been corrupted. It was the source of the influence that had taken control of the Skaal.
Until our next meeting, outsider.
Die!
Mostly staffs. They're my specialty.
It was very like the one you found in Miraak's temple. A thing of dark magic, not of the All-Maker.
Frea saw that the Tree Stone now stands imprisoned in Miraak's new temple. I doubt you can free it until his power is broken.
The Redoran Guard have spotted a pack of werewolves in the mountains. The hunters up at Frostmoon Crag might know more.
Yes. There are six sacred Stones - Wind, Water, Earth, Beast, Sun, and Tree. Through them the Oneness of the land is maintained.
You there. What brings you to this place? Why are you here?
Rrargh!
But beware. You are now walking the same road as Miraak.
I'm not sure. Did we build it? I can't remember...
Coast has been dangerous lately... lot of Reavers about. I've heard they're searching for the treasure of Haknir Death-Brand, the pirate king.
Krosis, thuri. That is impossible.
Show yourself!
The Earth Stone is there, and the rest... It's a shrine, but I... Did we build that? I'm not sure.
Look out!
Mu fen krif.
This... this is some dark magic. It has to be.
I must be going mad. But then, so must everyone else.
I will follow you, Skaal-friend, but I must return to the village afterward.
Yeeeaarrggh!
Mephala bless you! You found it!
May your hunts always bring you game.
Krosis, the land below us is empty of prey.
I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
You've brought warmth to my heart, outsider, and I'm in your debt.
May darkness never touch you.
Join you? You mean leave the village to journey with you and fight at your side?
Very well. I'm ready, Elder.
I knew her parents quite well, you know. Bera and Ulfarr were good people, very much in love.
Not sure. I was told it's an old Imperial farm that was wiped out by the eruption of the Red Mountain.
I could use your help.
Well, I suppose I could forget that I saw you this time.
Well, you've certainly proven your worth around here to me. Please, accept this gift as a token of my appreciation!
Is there still something you need of me?
Hunh!
Bru cha.
Come back and fight me!
Unnnhhhh.... it hurts...
Well, take a look at what I have and maybe we can make a deal.
I'm... I'm not really sure. I think it's important, but I can't say why...
I'm flattered, but the village is my home. It's very rare for one of the Skaal to leave, and I have responsibilities here.
Fort Frostmoth will never fall! Long live the Empire!
Who are the Reclamations?
You need to leave? Alright.
Show yourself!
I knew I heard something!
Hhyyaarrgghh!
Who's there?
Zu'u nis. I cannot do that.
Going to hide, are you?
Look at me, I'm a different person. And I have you to thank for it.
As I've already told you, I have no need of money.
The damn thing sunk right off the coast of Solstheim. Can you imagine?
Not... finished yet...
Nuh!
Yes, the "Strident Squall" or something like that.
Maah!
How can you have Dunmer blood in your veins and have no knowledge of Blacklight?
Rraaarrgghh!
I sense nothing nearby.
Well, you've certainly proven your worth around here to me. Please, accept this gift as a token of my appreciation!
Strength and courage be always with you.
Unh!
You've brought Raven Rock back from the brink, traveler. I don't know how to thank you.
Where'd you go?
Until next time, then.
The only mistake here belongs to you. You're a wanted woman and there's no way I'm letting you walk away.
Wise choice. Now come along with us. After we confiscate any stolen goods, you'll be free to go. After you pay the fine, of course.
Hit me harder!
I am the Ebony Warrior!
That's the spirit!
When next we meet, it will be at my last vigil.
Lead the way.
I could, but I won't.
Don't be ridiculous. Of course I can.
Except for you. You are my last challenge. Only you can send me to Sovngarde with honor.
No quests to be undertaken. No villains to be slain. No challenges to face.
The question is, should I? I suppose if it's going to be done right, I'll have to do it.
Make your preparations. When you are ready, come find me at my last vigil.
I have done all that can be done. There is nothing left.
You are the one.
It wouldn't do to have you become better than me after all.
It's Dunmer tradition for the ashes of the deceased to be placed in an ancestral tomb.
As second councilor, it's my responsibility to protect Councilor Morvayn from harm.
No, it's not my time...
This realm is beyond you. You have no power here.
I won't allow you to ruin years of planning!
Vilur Ulen was executed a short time later and his remains placed in the Ulen Ancestral Tomb.
I need you to start out by being my eyes and ears... search Raven Rock and see if you can root out these traitors.
The Ulen Family of House Hlaalu, a rival Great House, has placed a deathmark on the councilor's head.
It would be fair to say that House Redoran literally saved the Dunmer people from destruction.
Watch it Tilisu, I think we might have a visitor!
Leave us alone, monster!
Bring the man-beast down!
During the Oblivion Crisis, gates to the plane of Oblivion opened all over Morrowind.
The Empire pulled most of its forces out of Morrowind to deal with the gates in their own homeland, leaving us virtually defenseless.
The problem is I don't have any solid proof that anyone from House Hlaalu is hidden among us... only my suspicions.
What in the...?
Valin Ulen and his son's remains were both laid to rest there because that's what he'd requested.
Now that's just ridiculous!
For House Hlaalu! For Vilur Ulen!
Stop hiding, coward. I'll make it quick, I promise.
When Valin died, his family provided the funds to construct the tomb.
Kill the dragon, quickly!
As you command.
Bo pruzaan. Better to fly.

Aggh!
There is no telling what he would do to me.
Who am I?
Thank you, outlander.
Your soul belongs to Miraak!
The truth will take you!
Hiding is beneath you, Dragonborn.
Hyargh!
It's good to get the old nose working again. I missed sniffing out the ebony deposits and getting my hands dirty.
Master Neloth refused to teach me the Ash Guardian spell. So I read his spell book on my own and learned it.
Your blood will flow in Miraak's name!
Watch yourself out there... looks like an ash storm might be brewing.
I find them, clean them up and resell them.
Here do you toil.
Yearrgh!
No! Do not touch the Stone while Miraak controls it!
Hah Dov!
Grrargh!
We shall clear the way for the coming of the true Dragonborn!
Here in my temple.
Bless you, muthsera.
Then it is too late. The lie has already taken root in the hearts of men.
That you have forgotten.
You there! You're the one they call Dragonborn?
Come back! Wake up!
They've laughed at me, Aphia. They thought I was a crazy old fool. But I proved them wrong.
Unfortunately, I'd left the other guardsman behind and he never made it. Captain Veleth discharged me from service.
You cannot escape the truth. You cannot escape the True Dragonborn!
Things are picking up... for now.
Oof!
Hyargh!
Master Neloth is going to kill me. Assuming he doesn't make me into a test subject again.
What faithless minds have stolen.
And when the world remembers.
Feim...
My doors are open if you wish to discuss matters involving Raven Rock.
But you shall not evade us with guile and deceit. No. You shall pay for your blasphemy!
When Lord Miraak appears all shall bear witness. None shall stand to oppose him!
A few years ago, I was out on patrol with two other men when we were attacked by some ash spawn.
You shall not stand in the way of the true Dragonborn's return. He comes soon, and we shall offer him your heart!
Your lies fall on deaf ears, Deceiver! We know you are the False Dragonborn!
Ah, now we can finish this.
And when the world shall listen.
Wake up. Wake up!
Something went wrong when I cast it. The creature is attacking everything in sight.
Gah!
For Miraak!
You can see the book right here.
So tantalizingly close... But trust me, no magic will open that. I'd have had the book already if it could.
You might think it's all perfume and roses now that the mine's open, but all I see is a new security problem on our hands.
No, we'll have to do this the hard way. If we can restore the steam supply to this room, I'm certain I can open it.
Follow me.
You are in my power here.
Fus...
There's no escape from this place.
Councilor Morvayn was kind enough to allow Rirns and I to live in one of the abandoned buildings. At least it keeps the ash out of our eyes.
It's too late for regrets, Dragonborn.
Did you think to escape me?
Now through them do I speak.
Buy something or keep moving.
Bralsa's been nice enough to show me how to swing a pickaxe. She's an old hat when it comes to digging up ebony.
Hunh!
You must fight him!
Rraaah!
Sometimes things fall off the back of a cart.
You should not have come here!
Fo...
Nnnyyaarrgh!
Rraaarrgghh!
Hhyyaarrgghh!
Here you reclaim.
Rrargh!
Arrgh!
I may not be an expert at it yet, but it's good to be back to work and have some coin in my pockets.
How do you think? It's a blessing.
I was one of the wealthiest miners in town... I could haul up almost three or four times what the average digger could.
(hiss)
Zii...Gron!
Safe travels, outlander.
You are the true Dragonborn.
They sprung from the ground with no warning and killed one of my companions instantly. I was so frightened, I ran all the way back to Raven Rock.
Toor...Shul!
I never saw the end coming like it did... the mine running out of ebony.
I've been made the foreman of the mine thanks to everything you did down there.
Wagh!
Well, I put up with you, don't I?
Ro...Da!
You cannot escape Miraak's sight!
You're too kind to people, always giving them the benefit of the doubt. Don't know how you put up with it.
I've had to muster some more men to protect the mine, but I don't really have a problem with that.
Your hands once were idle.
Your lies fall on deaf ears, Deceiver. The True Dragonborn comes... You are but his shadow.
Miraak has you, just like the others!
I am embarrassed to admit that it was my fault.
Now through me do you see.
I appreciate the help you've been giving us.
Miraak help me!
Your eyes once were blinded.
You would dare call yourself the true Dragonborn?
All I'm wondering is how long it'll take for House Redoran to begin ignoring us again if the mine runs out of ore for a second time.
I need to keep Master Neloth distracted so he doesn't find out what I did.
Far from yourself.
Yeeeaarrggh!
Well of course, now that they're under House Redoran's protection, why would they want to go back to Mournhold?
When Lord Miraak appears all shall bear witness. None will there be who oppose him.
Here in my shrine.
Maah!
Unh!
There isn't a single night that passes where I don't regret what I did, but it's too late for that now.
Another offering for the Master.
So we shall rip the falsehood from their breasts by tearing the false heart from yours!
Bless you, sera.
You will be an offering to the Master!
The usual. Piles of armor to repair for the Redoran Guard.
You won't win!
That you might remember.
Making sure those shipments of ebony make it safely from the mine to the shipping docks is my new order of the day.
Master, guide my hand!
Be careful out there.
I've got regular paying customers again, thirsty workers at the end of the day, and more coin than I can count.
I say let them try. My men are ready for them.
I'm hearing that the Council will be staying in Blacklight permanently.
And with Solstheim crawling with reavers and Azura-knows what else, I can't risk any attacks on Raven Rock.
Nah...Kest!
(hiss)
Su...
(hiss)
Best of all, Aphia isn't so cross when I go down there any more!
The true Dragonborn returns to this world soon, and all will be judged!
I shall not fall!
Second Councilor Arano is concerned that once word reaches the reavers that the mine has reopened, they might think about paying us a visit.
I grow ever nearer to you.
Gargh!
Soon, we'll have a steady supply of workers and materials to keep things going for years to come.

I've only tried a few combinations, but things look promising. Here's what I've discovered so far:

Ruby + Albino Pod =

Jumping Flame Spider

Ruby + Damaged Pod =

Exploding Flame Spider

Ruby + Salt Pile + Damaged Pod =

4 3

Ruby + Salt Pile + Albino Pod =

Flame Cloaked Spider

[pagebreak] Looking at the results, it seems as though the purity of the gem could enhance the imbuing process in some unforeseen way. Perhaps if I could get my hands on a Flawless Ruby... I have also theorized that if one were to mix most any of the ingredients in the previous experiments a new discovery is likely to be made. Upon further inspection of both a diamond and a garnet it seems they don't contain the necessary power required. I know for a fact that a ruby works, as seen in my previous experiments. Next I'll see how the reaction works with an amethyst, emerald, or even a sapphire. There must be other types of spiders out there. Who knows what other kinds of imbuing processes have taken place. We'd best keep our eyes open. The source of the interaction will most likely be nearby, whatever new species we find.
You lack the required item.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> The Journal of Ralis Sedarys, Volume 23
Lord Ahzidal demands more blood, and I give it willingly. The hired men have somewhat pitiful souls, so it sometimes takes several of them to achieve the desired effects.
I won't be writing any more. There is no need. The time has come to awaken the master, and bring him to the fate he deserves.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> The Journal of Ralis Sedarys, Volume 19
Moving on to Solstheim next, chasing after vague rumors of this Kolbjorn Barrow. My patron seems confident we can find the Relics of Azhidal out here. I'm a bit skeptical, but so long as he pays well, I'll dig wherever the old coot likes.
Initial prospects look poor, to say the least. I was sure I had my map wrong at first, until it became clear that the place had just been lost to the ash. I'll dig out as much as I can, maybe see if I can recruit some of the local residents to help me out. I haven't seen anyone since I got out of Raven Rock, but I keep hearing conversations and whispers around me, so I just need to track them down.
I found Neloth's steward, Varona, dead on the road to Raven Rock.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> The Journal of Ralis Sedarys, Volume 20
This excavation is going to be one of the harder ones, I can tell. Hired some diggers out of Raven Rock. They all said they were experienced miners, but I guess they're not used to running into trouble as they dig. In a place like this, you never know what was buried long ago, and have to be ready for whatever you come across.
In any case, there were some unfortunate losses when the sleeping dead weren't quite sleeping and weren't quite dead. Operation is stalled unless my friendly partner is able to find enough coin for us to hire some replacements. Maybe it's time to take up a collection from the constant spectators who gather to mock me.
Your Voice bends the very stones to your will. As it gains power, animals, people and even dragons must do your bidding.

Neloth asked me to locate his steward, Varona Nelas. I found her dead body on the road to Raven Rock. Now Neloth wants me to find someone in Raven Rock willing to be his new steward. I've heard Drovas Relvi might be willing.
I found Varona's dead body on the road to Raven Rock, apparently killed by ash spawn. Now Neloth wants me to find someone in Raven Rock willing to be his new steward.
Neloth has asked me to locate his steward, Varona Nelas. Last time anyone in Tel Mithryn saw her, she was on her way to Raven Rock.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> The Journal of Ralis Sedarys, Volume 22
If it weren't for the comfort brought by my invisible friend, I would have fled this place long ago. I wish I had realized earlier that it was not a group, but a master who contains multitudes. He's guided me into a true understanding of the barrow, and I greatly desire to meet with him.
My insight into this place is now so intuitive, so fundamental, that I almost feel as if I built it myself. I explained to the workers how to use the tile set, but they seemed too afraid or uncoordinated to properly step on each tile quickly enough. No problems, nothing that the master cannot solve.
We will be able to converse properly soon enough.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> The Journal of Ralis Sedarys, Volume 21
My invisible "friends" have kept it up, drawing closer. It took me a while to realize they were hiding themselves, but I figure it's out of shame. It takes a certain type of cowardice to spend all your time questioning a man's worth and value. You'd think they'd have the decency to at least let me sleep, but they persist even there.
As for the dig, we continue to stall out with the opposition from within the barrow. I had hoped the hardy people of this island would be able to deal with shuffling bones, but I appear to have overestimated them. I won't make that mistake again.
Neloth has asked me to locate his steward, Varona Nelas. She is probably somewhere around Tel Mithryn.
Neloth asked me to locate his steward, Varona Nelas. I found her body on the road to Raven Rock.

Neloth asked me to locate his steward, Varona Nelas. I found her dead body on the road to Raven Rock. Neloth sent me to Raven Rock to find a new steward. I found Drovas Relvi, who seemed very eager to take the position.
Insert gold in to coin slot
How much would you like to enter?

I arrived at the old tomb to find Tharstan waiting for me. He was eager to start exploring the place, and he asked me to lead the way. First, I need to figure out how to open the doors in the main chamber. Once that's done, we can explore the tunnels beyond.
Helping Drovas has come back to bite me. He owed a money lender named Mogrul 1000 septims. Mogrul expected me to pay Drovas debt. However, I killed him instead.
Helping Drovas has come back to bite me. He owed a money lender named Mogrul 1000 septims. Now Mogrul expects me to pay Drovas' debt. If I don't, he's going to keep sending thugs after me.
Someone named Mogrul sent a messenger for me. This Mogrul wants to talk.
Neloth's former apprentice, Ildari Sarothril, was covertly attacking him. Deep under Highpoint Tower I confronted Ildari and killed her.
Part of the Telvanni tower at Tel Mithryn is withered. Elynea needs three taproots soaked in the headwaters of the Harstrad river to repair it.

I met Tharstan, a Nord from the Skaal village who discovered an old Draugr crypt. I agreed to accompany him in exploring the old crypt. Inside, we found the tomb of a Dragon Priest left behind long ago to guard against a traitor from his own order.

I met Tharstan, a Nord from the Skaal village who discovered an old Draugr crypt. I agreed to accompany him in exploring the old crypt. After we discovered a pair of Word Walls, as well as two pieces of an ancient claw, we gained entry into a sealed chamber. Tharstan's translations suggest that we'll find a Dragon Priest's sarcophagus nearby.

I met Tharstan, a historian living in the Skaal village who discovered the recently-unearthed entrance to an old crypt. He offered to hire me as protection while we explored the crypt, and asked me to meet him there if I was interested.

Part of the Telvanni tower at Tel Mithryn is withered. Elynea needs three taproots soaked in the headwaters of Harstrad river to repair it. Elynea kept two taproots for herself and told me to plant the last one in the withered part of the tower wall.
Neloth is being attacked by an unknown assailant. He gave me a ring that will identify the source of the attacks. If I walk around the grounds of Tel Mithryn, I might find a clue.

Neloth is being attacked by an unknown assailant. I discovered the source of the attacks was a heart stone hidden in Ildari Sarothril's grave. Neloth has divined that his former apprentice is still alive and seeking vengeance on him. Neloth asked me to track down and kill Ildari.
Helping Drovas has come back to bite me. He owed a money lender named Mogrul 1000 septims. Mogrul expected me to pay Drovas debt, which I've done.

I met Tharstan, a historian living in the Skaal village who discovered the recently-unearthed entrance to an old crypt. He offered to hire me as protection while we explored the crypt, and asked me to meet him there if I was interested.
Neloth is being attacked by an unknown assailant. He gave me a ring that identified the source of the attacks as a heart stone hidden in the grave of Ildari Sarothril.
Conjure Ash Guardian
I let Neloth cast an experimental spell on me. If I discover any side effects, I should tell him right away.
Neloth has located another of Hermaeus Mora's Black Books in <Alias=Dungeon>. He intends to read it as soon as I bring it to him.
Neloth has asked me to retrieve one of Azra Nightwielder's staffs. It's hidden in <alias=dungeon>.

and stay the course.
I let Neloth cast an experimental spell on me. I've discovered a potentially dangerous side effect. Normally it boosts my health, but if I am in the rain or swim, it reduces my health.

I knew if we dug deep enough we'd eventually hit some fresh ruins. Markarth, a city built upon a city. From early pieces recovered we've determined the name of the city is Nchuand-Zel, but past that we have very little info. We've been given an escort though and tomorrow we will delve into the city proper.

* * * * *


It's only been a day and I already miss my desk and chair. I thought it would be a little more fun to explore, but so far it's just been fighting spiders and getting to view an occasional rubble pile. Hopefully we get to the main ruin soon so we can set up a camp and I can start cataloguing some of the items I've been able to find.

* * * * *


We found the Armory earlier and Erj has stayed behind to find a way into the main vault. If anyone can open the locks it's him. We've kept going and settled up here for the night since the guards say it will be easy to defend. I've put up a few runes just in case.

I've slain General Falx Carius in the ruins of Fort Frostmoth and put an end to any further ash spawn attacking Raven Rock. Captain Veleth was very pleased with my results, and awarded me a bounty in gold.
Flawless Emerald + Salt Pile + Albino Spider Pod

Captain Veleth explained that the ash spawn have been attacking Raven Rock for some time now, and he's been trying to locate their source. His lack of manpower and reluctance to leave the town without a commander are keeping him from finding out more. As a result of our conversation, I've agreed to help him deal with this situation. I need to begin by searching the Attius Farm for clues that might lead me to the ash spawn's source.

Neloth is doing research on ash spawn. He's asked me to bring him a sample of the ash from one using a special extraction tool.

Neloth has asked me to retrieve one of Azra Nightweilder's staffs. It was hidden in <alias=dungeon>.
Neloth has asked me to examine a Briarheart warrior of the Forsworn tribes. I found one and saw how the heart was implanted.
Neloth has asked me to examine a Briarheart warrior of the Forsworn tribes. He couldn't direct me to a specific one, but he said they live in the hills on the western edge of Skyrim.

Baldor Iron-Shaper, the smith in Skaal Village, was abducted by the Thalmor. They were trying to get him to reveal the secret of forging Stalhrim. Wind and Sand Afa-Saryat

[pagebreak] [pagebreak]

Let the wind blow. Let the sand scour. Let the magic of air and sand be free to roam the Alik'r. From the mystic membranes that stand between the two, absorb and convey unto me and all who may understand the deep essential powers of the desert. [pagebreak] eserts are often considered to be useless wastelands, avoided by the casual traveler and shunned by the softer species as unfit for civilization. But to those who bother to investigate, to dwell, to live, to linger in these spaces, a driving hardiness develops that serves them well in all environs should they ever choose to live. A thoughtfulness born of care -- for who knows best how to best invest their resources than one who has had to walk half a morning and labor for an hour to extract a few drops of water from an unyielding plant? This same sort of requisite thrift applies to all other creatures who wring their living in such a land. The insight that may at first be missed, though, is that the magic of this land is similarly affected. Forgoing the showy lights and sounds of the forest dwelling mages in Summerset, the flamboyant gesticulations of the Bretons, or even the bellowing of the Nords, there is a certain economy to the casting of a true Alik'r wizard. This is not meant as a slight against other magical styles, only noting that a such energies might be better focused into reflection and purpose. [pagebreak] On Sand When both foreigners and natives imagine the desert, often their first image is one of orange-hued sand blowing beneath a dark blue sky. Indeed, this is not wholly incorrect, as the shifting sands are one of the key components not only of the desert, but of its natural magics. Consider: sand is nothing but the weathering of rocks, older by far than any of the living inhabitants who claim a land as "theirs." As each rock breaks further, more of its inner space is revealed, until it is practically naught but exposed surface in its aggregate self. This collective then scatters, intermingles, scatters, and repeats, in infinite combinations so long as Nirn continues to exist. If we believe, as I do, that the rocks themselves contain remnants of Magnus's gift, than this exposure and combinatorial explosion results in a breadth and diversity of magic energy as is unknown elsewhere in Tamriel. [pagebreak] On Air Much as the sand learns from every grain around it, so too does the air which conveys it from one combination to the other absorb the sense knowledge of its carried grains. In fact, it is plausible that the air itself is guiding the combinations to novelty and expression. Indeed, consider that in the Nordic tradition, Kyne is the widow of Shor (an aspect of Lorkhan), then her ministrations (via wind) to his physical legacy within Mundus could be seen as a form of celestial mourning, from which we mortals can benefit. It would seem, indeed, that the next level of magical awakening may well be driven by scrying appropriate wind channels to carve novel paths through the vast desert such as to further diversify the land's memory. Reading the knowledge of the sands, though, is an immense task in itself, though, more fit to an army of clerical workers than a wizard of any standing.

30 Rain's Hand 4E10 Received a letter from the East Empire Company today. They say that some of the miners broke through the wall in shaft three of Raven Rock Mine and found some ruins. I hope this isn't another waste of time like that fiasco they sent me to in Cyrodiil. I'll gather my assistant, Millius and sail back to Raven Rock at first light... it'll be nice to see the old house in Solstheim again. 7 Second Seed 4E10 Finally arrived in Raven Rock and was surprised at the number of dark elf refugees living in town. They aren't really from mining stock, but I think they'll make fine workers one day. Millius and I spent a good part of the day clearing the ash off of the roof of my house. The damn volcano is still erupting almost day and night. If it wasn't for the ash covering everything it would almost look beautiful. 8 Second Seed 4E10 Millius and I are headed into Raven Rock Mine to have look at whatever it is the miners uncovered. I think I'll stop by the old Swing and Scoop and pick up a few supplies before we head down. Couldn't hurt to be prepared. 9 Second Seed 4E10 Looks like the miners broke right through the wall of an old Nordic barrow. I've seen this sort of thing in Skyrim before... damn Nords have barrows dotting the landscape and almost none of them are ever marked on any maps. Looks like this barrow belong to something called the "Bloodskal Clan." I'm going to take some rubbings of the inscriptions on the tombs and see if I can't learn some more information from my history books. 10 Second Seed 4E10 It's been a few days and I can't find even a single mention of this clan anywhere. Millius and I decided to proceed ahead. We've come to a dropdown point, but I can see a massive chamber below. Took the better part of a day to lower everything down and climb down the almost sheer drop. 11 Second Seed 4E10 It's been an astonishing day of discovery! After exploring the large chamber beyond the dropoff, I was startled to find the strangest weapon I've ever laid eyes upon sitting on a pedestal of sorts. The blade appears to be flawless, and is emitting a faint chilling glow. Bits of parchment I found about the chamber seem to call this "The Bloodskal Blade." Not certain if I should remove it yet, I think I'll sleep on it.

12 Second Seed 4E10 I've decided against my own better judgment to remove the Bloodskal Blade from its pedestal. Millius seems completely against it, but we need to bring this wondrous artifact with us when we find a way out of the barrow. 13 Second Seed 4E10 I should have listened to Millius. The moment the blade was lifted, we were set upon by draugr. Millius fought bravely, but he fell. I was able to destroy the remaining ones, but I was badly wounded. I can barely stand. My only chance would be finding a way out of this place, but I fear that I'm trapped. 14? Second Seed 4E10 Exploring has been slow. I can only move for maybe a few minutes at a time before I have to rest. My supplies are running low, and I'm feeling weaker by the hour. The only progress I've made is finding a strange door with markings on it that I've never seen. There appears to be something to them I'm missing, as they've confounded my attempts at getting through. I'll have to study this further in order to make any progress... barely can keep awake. I'm fairly certain that the key to the door involves the use of the Bloodskal Blade. When swinging the weapon, I'm noticing a ribbon of mystical energy emanating from it. I think by swinging the sword in different directions, it's possible to manipulate this ribbon and solve whatever puzzle this door presents. I hope to get well enough to put this to the test soon... each swing is a huge effort. Last entry I've lost track of time and my strength is fading. I can't even stand anymore. My wounds refuse to heal. I'm afraid this tomb will become my resting place. If anyone finds this journal, please send these notes to my superiors at the East Empire Company and tell my wife that I love her. May Arkay guide me to my final rest.

The Axe Man A surprising way to become proficient with an axe

[pagebreak]

f all the members of the Morag Tong I've spoken with, none disturbed me as much as Minas Torik. A quiet and reserved man who never drank, never visited a brothel or even uttered a curse, he was famous for his ability to make people disappear. Once a person was targeted by the Brotherhood and Torik was sent to them, they would simply cease to be. I asked him once what his weapon of choice was, and was equally startled by his answer. "I only likes to use axes," he said in his typical, quiet voice. The image of this silent, dour fellow attacking anyone with a weapon as inherently bloody and violent as an axe so frightened and intrigued me that I questioned him about it further. This is an inherently dangerous activity, for assassins are not typically keen to give out their stories. Torik did not mind the questions, though it took some time to get the full story out of him, as naturally shy and reserved as he was. It seemed that Torik had been orphaned as a very young age and sent to live with his uncle, a saltrice plantation owner in Sheogorad in northern Vvardenfell. The man promised to show his nephew the business and eventually make him a partner when he was old enough. In the meantime, the boy was put to work as his uncle's house servant. It was a grueling life as the old man was very particular about how things should be done. The boy was first required to give all the floors in the house a thorough scouring, from the attic to the cellar. Whenever the floor was not cleaned to the uncle's satisfaction, which was frequent, Torik was thrashed and forced to begin again. The boy's second duty was to ring the bell that would bring the laborers into the house. This was done at least four times a day, once for each meal, but if his uncle had any news or additional instructions for the laborers - which he frequently did - the bell might need to be sounded a dozen times or more. It was a huge iron bell in the tower and the boy quickly discovered that he had to throw his entire body into the motion of pulling the chain in order to have it sound loud enough to bring everyone in from the field. If he was tired and did not pull the backbreaking chain hard enough, his uncle was soon at his side to beat him until he rang the bell loud and clear. Torik's third task was dusting all the shelves in his uncle's vast library. As deep and old as the shelves were, he was required to work with a long, heavy duster on a rod. The only way that he could reach to the back of the shelves was to hold the duster at his shoulder and then swing it out in a sweeping motion. Again, if the uncle saw any dust left over or felt that the boy was not working as hard as he ought to, the punishment was swift and severe. After several years, Minas Torik grew into a young man, but his job responsibilities were not increased. His uncle promised to teach him the business, once Torik had demonstrated his mastery of his servile assignments. Divorced from any knowledge of any work other than his own, Torik never knew how badly in debt his uncle was and how poorly the farm's yield was. In his eighteenth year, Torik was called into the cellar by his uncle. He thought that he had not done a good enough job scouring the floor down there, and was frightened of the beating to come. What he found, however, was his uncle packing his goods into crates. "I'm leaving Morrowind," he explained. "The business has gone sour, so I thought I'd try my luck running a caravan in Skyrim. I understand there's good money to be made, trading fake Dwemer artifacts to the Nords and Cyrodiils. I wish I could take you with me, my lad, but there won't be much need for scouring, bell pulling, and dusting where I'm going." "But uncle," said Torik. "I can't read, I knows nothing of the business you promised to teach me. What wills I dos on my own?" "I'm certain you can find a job in some domestic capacity," shrugged the uncle. "I've done my best with you." Torik had never stood up to his uncle before, and felt no anger only a sort of coldness that gripped his heart. Among his uncle's possessions being packed away was an old heavy iron axe, allegedly of Dwemer manufacture. He picked it up in his hands and was surprised to find that it was not much heavier than his dusting rod. In fact, it felt very comfortable as he pulled it over his shoulder and swung it out as he had done so many times before. In this instance, however, he swung it into his uncle's right arm. The old man screamed with pain and rage, but for some reason, Torik didn't feel frightened anymore. He propped the axe against his other shoulder, and swung it out again. It cut a swath across the old man's chest and he fell to the floor. Torik hesitated before lifting the axe above his head. It was another natural position for him, like he was ringing a bell. Over and over again, he swung down as if he was calling the laborers in from the field. Except that this time, there was no sound except for a wet thump, and no laborers came in from the field. Of course, his uncle had sent them away hours before. After a time, there was nothing left of his uncle that couldn't be washed down the cellar drain. The process of cleaning up came easily to Torik as well. Blood scrubbed up much quicker than the usual grime and saltrice flour that littered the cellar floor. It was well known that Torik's uncle was planning to leave Morrowind, so his disappearance provoked no suspicion. The house and all the belongings were sold to the debt collectors, but Torik took the axe. It seemed that his uncle had given him some worthwhile business skills after all.

The True Noble's Code by Serjo Athyn Sarethi

[pagebreak]

he honorable warriors of the Great House Redoran are the hereditary defenders of the Morrowind. To be a noble of House Redoran is more than being a great warrior. One must follow the triune virtues of duty, gravity, and piety. A Redoran's duty is first to the Tribunal Temple, second to the Great House Redoran, and third to one's family and clan. In the Battle of Red Mountain, warriors of House Redoran died bravely for their duty to the Tribunal. By defending House Redoran from the schemes of Telvanni wizards and the lies of untrustworthy Hlaalu, the true noble shows duty to House Redoran. Following the Temple's guidelines of mercy and generosity show duty to one's family and clan. A Redoran noble must know the virtue of gravity. It is not the Redoran way to laugh at serious matters, for it shows disrespect. It is not the Redoran way to spread rumors, for they fester and breed dissention. A Redoran must show piety to the Aedra and Daedra, our creators and ancestors. For without the divine, we would not have the chance to serve. And without divine law, we would not know right from wrong. And without giving thanks for these things, we would forget out place and our purpose. Great House Redoran praises all the skills of war. Not because we believe war is good or honorable in its own right, but because this knowledge is necessary to perform one's duty. House Redoran's warrior fight with a long blade and a shield or with a spear. A noble of House Redoran must also learn to use a bow and must be athletic enough for the long marches to battle. A Redoran wears heavy or medium armor depending on rank and strategy. A noble of House Redoran is expected to know how to repair and maintain his own armor. Those who are born to House Redoran have been taught their skill and virtues by kin and clan. Those who seek to enter House Redoran as retainers must satisfy an examiner in the Redoran Council Hall that their skills are suitable for service to House Redoran. Whether born to the blood of House Redoran, or adopted into service of House Redoran by oath, those who seek to advance in the ranks of House Redoran must demonstrate their virtues by service and obedience. And only when one has mastered all the skills and virtues can one truly call himself a noble of the Great House Redoran.

I helped the warriors of Thirsk Mead Hall retake their home from the infestation of Rieklings. She expressed a desire to lead the hall anyway, and when I opposed her fraud, she attacked me.
Adril Arano has sent me to Ashfallow Citadel to destroy Vendil Ulen and whatever forces he's amassed there. I'm supposed to meet two Redoran Guard outside the ruins who will assist me in this regard.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'> These warrens are well suited to me. I can plot my vengeance undisturbed. I've created many ash spawn and summoned atronachs to do my bidding. Yet I know it isn't enough. Neloth is a wily old wizard. I need more power.
I'm out of test subjects, except for Niyya. I saved her for last. She pretended to be my friend when I first came here. But now I know the truth. The voices have told me all about her lies and betrayal. She works with Neloth to bring me down. I've saved a special experiment just for her. It will take quite a while to complete.
I can't attack Neloth directly, he's too powerful. But I can make his life uncomfortable. I've killed his steward. I've withered his home. Maybe I should poison his precious tea. I'll need a more capable servant for that. The ash spawn are too clumsy for such delicate work.

I've recovered evidence from Severin Manor that exposes the true nature of the Severin family. The letters indicate that Vendil Severin is actually Vendil Ulen and that his supposed wife Tilisu and his daughter Mirri are members of House Hlaalu, one of the Great Houses that opposes Morvayn's House Redoran. All three of them are working in conjuction with unknown forces in a place called "Ashfallow Citadel," to assassinate Councilor Morvayn. I need to bring this urgent revelation to Adril Arano immediately.

<font face="$HandwrittenBold" size="19"> Mother,
I understand your worries, but there's really nothing that should frighten you that much. The first crew working here was a bunch of idiots and milk-drinkers who didn't know how to watch their own backs. We might run into some trouble, but I've handled trouble before.
The one who hired us, Ralis, is a bit of an odd one. I'm keeping my eye on him, though, so don't add that to your fretting. We'll be fine. We'll all be fine. Just worry about you and father, and let me worry about myself.
We'll talk when I'm home. There should be money enclosed with this, and if it's missing you should take it out of the courier's hide.
Yours, Mireli </font>
I agreed to fund Ralis Sedarys' expedition to excavate Kolbjorn Barrow, but once again, he needs more gold to hire increasingly reluctant miners and guards to work on the site.

Mora's Grasp: Freezes the target between Oblivion and Tamriel for 30 seconds, making them immune to all damage.
You may only accept one ability from this book at a time.

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'><font size='18'> The fools have taken me in. Weak, pathetic men intent on looting this ancient fortress with their crude mining. Niyya is pleasant enough. I may choose to spare her when the time comes.
I'm still weak from Neloth's betrayal. He promised me power and glory. He failed to mention the constant pain. And the voices. By the three, I would do anything to not hear the voices.
When my strength returns, I will have my vengeance upon my former master. I can feel the power of the heart stone beating inside me. I need to find a way to tap into its power. Then he shall pay in blood and fire and ash.
Especially effective against horkers.

<font face="$HandwrittenBold"> 1.
I've arrived in Solstheim, and moved into an old house on the hill by the shore. Whoever lived here before is long gone.
2.
I can see well out into the waters from my vantage here, and can hear all things behind and around. Dunmer bandits wander the woods at night, but I don't fear them.
5.
There is a calling from the depths; a rumble drone that sings to me at night. I've started sleeping in the basement + keeping a knife near. The call is loudest down here. I will to be ready for whatever is coming...
6.
it is as if a great machine reverberates beneath me
10.
i tire of waiting for the caller underneath to emerge
i walked to town + bought some digging tools: shovel, shovel, pick i started to break down the wall behind the bookshelf + dig down slow going i put the bookshelf back when i finish digging why? no houseguests here but i feel i have something to hide
13.
how can i make bjorn hear what i have heard? i must not lose him yet i must remain in this place for i know i will know the truth soon
23.
the murmurer in the earth and i we talk i lay my head against the dirt
51.
fire from the deep </font>
Mora's Agony removed
Sapphire + Damaged Albino Spider Pod

<font face='$HandwrittenFont'> If you're reading this, run. Get back in your boat and row as far and as fast as you can. There is no safe harbor here, there is no treasure worth the horror that awaits you. It's a miracle you aren't dead already.
Haldyn sent us from Japhet's Folly out into the sea, looking for hidden islands and forgotten coves. He said we needed outposts all around Tamriel to hide all the treasure we're soon to pillage. I say he's mad. A fresh group like us has more immediate concerns than outposts. We don't even have a name yet.
But I kept my mouth shut, my head down, and did what I was told. I wish to the Nine that I'd have said something...
This island looked so peaceful, so remote. Seemed like a good place for an outpost. Bjord and I stayed behind while the others scouted about. It wasn't long before we heard the screams. We peered over the rocks and I can't even describe what we saw, although I'll never forget it. The blood. Gods, the blood...
What those monsters did brought out the coward in Bjord. All it did to me was raise a fire in my chest, a hate in my gut so strong I can almost feel it coursing into the mace in my hand. I told Bjord to run, to tell the others never to come here. I stayed to write out this warning to anyone unlucky enough to land on this rock.
Now that I've done that duty, there's only one thing left. I'm going to kill as many of those things as I can. I'm even going to try for the big one.
Maybe I'll do it. Maybe I'll kill every one of them. Maybe you've found this rock abandoned and safe. I doubt it... </font>
Amethyst + Salt Pile + Albino Spider Pod
