Tel Mithryn is the safest place in Solstheim. Only a fool would challenge Master Neloth.
Now... my prey awaits. Good hunting to you.
Well, the dragons are a constant danger, but so far they have taken little interest in our village. Thank the All-Maker for that!
How can the Skaal stand it up here? It's freezing!
It's true that I normally prefer to stay home and conduct my research in peace. Everything's so much more convenient there.
But, given that something seems to be taking control of the minds of all the inhabitants, I thought it worth investigating.
What... what was that?
Tribe-kin live all places. All of world within great water.
Ah, my benefactor.
Why are we up here? The smell is just... ugh.
Thanks for taking that thing down. We're supposed to be warriors, not crafters.
Well, look who it is.
We can do this thing.
Hot fire. Cold dizzydrink. Happy tribe.
Unh...
What do... huh?
Huh?
Were we... did you help us?
Glad to not be working on that ugly thing anymore. Finally getting some sleep.
I'd rather make mead than ugly shrines. You did good getting us away from there.
What's that?
I am sorry, but my duty is to my people right now.
Kawafoo.
Baroo?
Just be sure to bring an ancient Nord pickaxe with you. It's the only pickaxe that can mine the Stalhrim properly without breaking it.
Joooo fah!
Araa.
We must leave this place!
With skill and patience. It's very much like working ebony.
It is not safe here! We must go back to the village!
Well, first you'll need to obtain some Stalhrim, of course, and then you'll need to work it.
I suppose Master Neloth won't mind. He's always telling me to get out of his way.
Joooo fah!
You must fight against what is controlling you!
Yes... I'd say if you know how to forge ebony, then you know everything you need to know in order to forge Stalhrim.
You can find some in Raven Rock Mine, as well as that new source of Stalhrim on the map you recovered from the elves.
Ysra, I'm here to help you!
It has been an honor, Skaal-friend.
Yes. It is.
Come back when you have the coin.
An Amulet of Mara? You're not married? Surprising.
Your call.
You go ahead and arrange the wedding ceremony when you're ready.
As you wish.
It's all in the swing. Let me show you.
Then lead on, friend.
I'll gladly share my knowledge with you.
I'll show you what I can about protecting yourself.
I'm the best warrior in Morthal, and that's no boast.
I am Hermaeus Mora. I am the guardian of the unseen, and knower of the unknown. I have been watching you, mortal.
Your free will is an illusion. Whether you acknowledge me or not is your own business. But I will be in your mind.
Have you spoken to the Temple of Mara, yet? I'm so excited.
You should tell the priest we're getting married. They'll take things from there.
That amulet. I've seen the Nords wear these when they're looking to marry. With your strength, you should have no trouble.
Lead the way.
Never thought I'd get married under a Nord god. But with you, it feels right.
Most impressive.
Milk drinker.
We have our wedding soon, don't we? That's right, we do!
Hey, shouldn't you tell the Temple of Mara that we're getting married? Be hard to have a wedding without a priest.
Come on, you monster!
You should arrange the ceremony at the Temple of Mara right away. I can't wait.
Our wedding is soon. I'll see you then!
Skyrim belongs to the Nords!
Won't lie, I am. And you?
I used to be an adventurer in my day, then I settled down. Got married.
An Amulet of Mara, you're looking for marriage, then?
You deal with them, I'll make sure you get paid. Maybe this old soldier will throw in some lessons as well.
Show those marauders what Windhelm justice tastes like.
But a group of Dark Elf refugees gets ambushed? A group of Argonians, or a Khajiit caravan? No troops. No investigation. Nothing.
What do you need to take?
I'm heading home if you need me.
I'd best get back to Master Neloth then. No telling what's happened since I've been gone.
Yes, Thane. What is it?
The wedding is soon. It'll be a good day.
Fine! I'll take care of it, just please leave me alone!
Look at you. Wearing an Amulet of Mara. Are you saying you're available?
That's a brave offer. I'd be happy to throw in my coin behind that.
Now shouldn't you be off arranging our wedding day? Don't keep me waiting.
Whenever a group of marauders attack a Nord village, Ulfric is the first to sound the horn and send the men.
You've embarrassed the temple and spat in the face of love. What do you want?
Still have something you need?
Take a look.
Is that an Amulet of Mara? I'm surprised someone like you isn't spoken for.
Here, some gold as promised, and let me show you a bit about wearing heavy armor. Save you some aches on a long march.
Right, then.
You're wearing Mara's amulet? You? I'd marry you. I'd marry you twice.
You should speak to the priest in the Temple of Mara to arrange the ceremony. No sense waiting.
I'll see you at our wedding!
I'm looking forward to our wedding. You and me....
Is that Lady Mara's amulet? I'm shocked a fine person like you isn't married already.
Come on. Let's see what you're made of.
Who do you think brought Septimus here? Who do you think protected you on your journey to open the box and loose my knowledge on this world?
Ugh. You mangy piece of pit-bait.
You already appear to have someone with you.
Did you need something?
No problem, I'll handle it.
I'm sorry, that can't be done.
I'm right behind you.
Anything else before you go?
I'm sorry, but I'm not going to do something like that. Even for you.
Bralsa, I can barely feed myself...
Don't be ridiculous. Who would run this place?
Nothing for now. But watch your back. I'll be sending collectors to find you. They won't ask so nicely.
Some consider my methods harsh, but playing the coddling nursemaid has never won a battle.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island.
Understandable considering the differences between us.
How about you keep serving the drinks, and I'll decide what's right for her!
Are you prepared to deal with Ildari?
As leader of the Skaal, I name you friend to our people. You are welcome here.
I don't know what your playing at, Glover... but something about you just doesn't add up.
The security of both Raven Rock and Councilor Morvayn is my primary concern.
Yes, yes. As I was saying, heart stones can animate nearby ash.
Is it done? Is the Ash Guardian gone?
Uh...Well, sort of.
Of course, Elder. Please forgive me.
Don't worry. If you die, I'll find some other way to take care of Ildari.
Don't pity me. And don't look at me like that. I know what I am.
Every Dunmer left a piece of themselves behind when they departed our homeland. All we can do is make the most of what we have.
Of course, here you are.
I hesitate to ask for anything else. Your family's done so much for us already.
Don't let my posting here fool you. I was once in command of over a hundred troops... my luck simply changed when our homeland was destroyed.
I understand. I know you're doing everything you can.
I can't believe Miraak made us build those shrines. To take our free will like that... just horrible.
I never got a chance to thank you for everything you've done. Ever since your mother died...
If you're looking for a room, or perhaps some libations, you've come to the right place.
I heard from Deor how you went in search of Baldor. That was very brave, and in fact, that's just the kind of courage I'm looking for.
Sometimes I wonder if we're the only Skaal. Could there be more villages like ours?
Allow me to apologize for Crescius's behavior, I'm afraid he hasn't been himself lately.
Me? No. Highpoint Tower will be filled with monsters and traps.
Tell you what. I'll make sure we have a permanent foot patrol over there. It's the least I can do for you.
My apologies for doubting you, serjo.
Now why would I want to work for House Telvanni?
Maybe not. I hear they've been seen over Skyrim too.
As the wife to the Second Councilor of Raven Rock, it would be my pleasure to help you any way that I can.
I'm sorry if I was hard on you before.
Unless you're ready to go fight those things, just leave me.
Food, coin, anything you can spare?
But it would have to be very close by. Where exactly did you find this heart stone?
Look, "dearest", what I do on my own time is my business. You stick to your business and we'll both be fine.
Nothing... I... I was just making conversation.
Anything you can offer, please. I'm starving.
Forbidden knowledge was somewhat of a specialty of the dwarves, eh? You don't think they would just leave it alone, do you?
If you need a ride back to the mainland, Gjalund's the only way off this rock.
You've succeeded where I've failed by ending the threat to Councilor Morvayn's life. I shall not forget it.
I don't know what we'd do without him. Send him my thanks.
Locked? Are you certain, Elder?
Well, I might soon. Neloth does pay well.
What if Miraak decides to make us do something else next... like kill someone we love. I can't bear the thought!
Could it be? Could Ildari still be alive? Could she be my nemesis?
Skooma! Lovely skooma. But I'd sooner give it up than go work for her.
So, Ildari does live after all.
I've told young Nikulas that the world beyond our lands is no place for the Skaal, but he won't listen.
Elder, why have the Reclamations destroyed the Tribunal?
What a relief. Master Neloth surely would have punished me had he found out.
I owed him a thousand septims, but not any more.
That dunmer is crazy!
I wish you could just relax a little...
I can't thank you enough for reopening the ebony mines. You've brought light to the darkness, my friend.
Anything you can contribute to Raven Rock will be greatly appreciated... and rewarded appropriately, of course.
Don't let me catch you spending it at the Netch.
Yes. Yes, I do.
Have you taken leave of your senses? We could be exposed... ruined. Ten years of planning all for nothing!
We'll figure something out. And I'll get better, I promise.
I fear what would have happened if you hadn't freed us.
I think I can teach you a thing or two.
Sorry about the thugs and Mogrul and everything.
Yes. I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind.
Looking for any potions? Ingredients? Alchemical supplies?
May I have a word with you, Councilor?
I'd be on the first ship off of this island if I had the coin. What a waste.
It's quiet for the moment.
Now that is a dangerous path indeed. Hermaeus Mora gives nothing away for free.
Fethis! How's that pretty young daughter of yours doing?
One way or the other, I'll get my money.
There's nothing beyond the Bulwark except wild Nords and ash wastes.
Skyrim. Born and raised.
Need to get back to my anvil.
The mines are open and the ebony has begun to flow because of your discovery. My eternal gratitude and blessings go with you, friend.
So what do you think, Vendil? You think this town will survive?
I should have another batch of vegetables ready for you soon, Geldis.
Nah. I don't think so.
Fethis, all of us mourn your wife's passing. Just don't let it affect how you treat your daughter.
If you've got any gripes, check in at Morvayn Manor. Second Councilor Arano will sort you out.
Don't make me choose, father... I beg you!
Assisting the Redoran Guard with the ash spawn attacks has earned you quite the reputation here. Keep it up.
Yes, this camp is small, but it's all we have left.
If you intend to wander Solstheim, you do so at your own risk.
Elder Othreloth is grooming me to be his eventual replacement. Soon, I'll be running the Temple my way.
In fact, it's not likely I'll ever have it. Expenses you know.
There was a time when this town meant something. Now it's all gone.
If I could only get my hands on Miraak. I'd make him pay for playing with my mind.
If I don't, he'll find a new mycologist who will.
Someone should do something about that damned Ash Guardian.
If you're a talker, go talk to my wife.
Have you been by Thirsk? Have you seen... is there any of the mead left?
Now get outta here.
That fetcher told me to fix his house.
If they desire salvation, the citizens of Raven Rock need to open their eyes... and their pockets.
I'm going to be fine, my love. Captain Veleth would never allow anything to happen to us.
The way I figure it, it's your fault he can't pay me. So I guess I'm going to have to collect it from you.
Sounds like you've had a rough day.
Would he give me skooma? I might do it for some skooma.
Look around you, Kuvar. If any of us were strong, we wouldn't be on this beach.
They're incredible. I don't know how we ever got them to take in this soil, but I'm glad they did.
My father needs me. He can't run his market stand alone.
No, you won't. But I'll love you anyway.
Are the ash yams growing like you expected this season?
Something about the waters attracts them.
If you're here about the Rieklings just... tread quietly around my sister.
Even so, there is more than enough evidence that someone is out to get me.
I can't believe you found a way to reopen the mines. I don't know how to thank you.
Then my steward was killed. You had to find me a replacement.
But they are for her to use to repair my withered tower.
Traveling beyond The Bulwark will be much safer as the result of your victory at Fort Frostmoth. Many thanks.
If you cast the spell without a heart stone, it attacks anything in sight.
Decades of loyal service, and he'd just throw me out like yesterday's breakfast!
She's jealous. Can't say that I blame her.
The Tribunal's destruction was wrought by their own hands. Their actions, or lack of action caused their downfall.
What? That fool.
I hope you enjoy your stay in Raven Rock.
Remember your lessons, Attendant.
My apprentice has overstepped his bounds this time.
No need to involve Master Neloth in this. It's just between the two of us.
Dangerous knowledge is still knowledge and therefore useful. Usually turns out to be the most useful, in my experience.
Fine! Let it be on your own head then.
This is a decent spot. We're right on the water. This could grow into something respectable.
I do enjoy sharing stories of my travels in Tamriel with young Nikulas.
Well, at least it's handled now.
My husband Vendil feared visitors would shun Raven Rock. I'm glad to see he was mistaken.
Your efforts in Raven Rock have proven most invigorating for my husband. I haven't seen him this pleased in many years.
He's twice her age and they barely know each other. You expect me to ignore them?
Damn that man! He is being totally unreasonable.
I need to tell Master Neloth about that Ash Guardian, but I don't dare leave my home.
How many did we lose this time?
Have you dealt with the Ash Guardian?
I'm an old woman. I can't possibly make that trip. It's way too dangerous.
Modyn Veleth, Captain of the Redoran Guard at your service.
Three taproots soaked in the headwaters of the Harstrad river.
I could swing a pickaxe better than any man in the mines. Made thousands of coins. Now it's all gone.
Always nice to speak to someone from the mainland.
Not yet. That may come later. First I need to identify the culprit.
You've brought so much hope to our people, we are forever in your debt.
He's the closest thing I've had to a brother, and we all owe him our lives. Am I to suddenly turn my back?
Misery? I'll give you misery. Try getting assigned to scrape netch scum off the front of the Bulwark.
I am Othreloth, Elder of the Reclamations and keeper of this Temple.
Don't be put off by my husband's mood... he enjoys having visitors.
I've tried hitting against a stump by my tent but... iron needs iron, if you want it shaped right.
She thought she could hide from me, but she can't!
It gets lonely out here you know, on this remote island.
Ha ha ha! Gods, that's rich. Work for Neloth. Ha ha ha!
Anything to report, Captain Veleth?
The Dwemer certainly knew how to build for the ages. These towers have outlasted their creators by millenia.
Though our spirits may be low, and danger lurks beyond the light, I am confident that They will never abandon us again.
This Dark Elves of Raven Rock keep to their city, and we Skaal keep to our village.
Your visit here will be tolerated as long as you abide by our laws, otherwise you'll answer to the Redoran Guard.
They abandoned us long ago, so your contacts are meaningless here. That's it.
Here. Take these. I'll sell you more if you come back later.
Tired of running? I knew you were weak. Now pay me.
There's no reason to bourdon you with my troubles.
I suppose you think you should get paid for helping an old woman.
You don't need to say anything, father. I miss her too.
Good. Now maybe Neloth will get off my back about it.
The historian has not stopped speaking your praises.
Ildari? Then it's my own fault. She was my apprentice before Talvas.
Are you ready to pay me yet?
Ash spawn keep appearing.
She has no idea what she's getting herself into. You may not always be there to take care of her.
I wished to bless the tombs with the monthly invocation, but I couldn't get the door to open.
It seems the dwarves were as interested in the Black Books as we are.
You think you have it bad? Try walking the Bulwark at night.
Take that last taproot and plant it into the wall of the withered house.
It was her time, father. None of us have any control over that. You mustn't blame yourself.
An old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions.
I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
You. You strong.
Did you look over next month's expenses? Will we have enough?
Those East Empire people should be ashamed of themselves for abandoning Raven Rock.
Well let's move then!
Perhaps that's reassuring enough for you, but it's something that still keeps me awake at night.
It was quite annoying when she died.
Welcome to Raven Rock, traveler. Could I interest you in any fine ash-grown foods?
I'd be better off with some mead in my belly, but the air in Solstheim is almost as sweet.
A new batch of the Ashfire should be ready for bottling soon, unless the rieklings used it for bathwater.
I brought down as much as I could when we ran off, but it will only last so long.
There are bound to be some there, so be careful.
Sorry, friend, I can't make anything for you down here. I'll need to get back to my forge.
You don't have to live like this now, though.
Squatting isn't tolerated in the abandoned buildings. If you need a place to stay, head to the cornerclub.
Prospecting for ebony? You're wasting your time. The mine's as dry as a bone.
If you find the time, couldn't hurt to pay your respects at the Temple.
I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack.
How much do I owe you this time?
Wait a moment while I cast a more specific divination.
I don't really have time for this.
Steel, dwarven, ebony... if it's broken, I can mend it.
This may be the frontier, but we've still got rules. Break them and you'll wind up in the prisons.
Casting off!
Suit yourself.
You honor the Reclamations with your actions. This will not be forgotten.
Unless you can help, leave us in peace.
Is something amiss, Cindiri? I can sense your concern.
There have been many strangers in our lands these past few moons.
Vendil Severin. A pleasure to meet you, serjo.
Come to mock our shame, like the others?
Geldis, I want you to let me know if you see Dreyla with Captain Veleth. I don't trust him.
It's been a long time since I walked the ashlands of Vvardenfell. I miss it terribly.
Don't let the state of Raven Rock fool you. Our desire for Raven Rock's return to its former glory is as strong as The Bulwark itself.
We call you a friend, but you must still respect our ways.
I just wanted to make sure you were all right.
Your worry helps nobody.
I'm worried. I think she knows.
It's not your fault. There were too many of them. Nobody could have known...
Don't you see, though? None of that matters. I'm going to go down as "the Unworthy" because of that rabble.
That's impossible. Wait... unless she didn't actually die! The heart stone could have kept her right at the edge of life and death.
He's twice your age and only wants to marry into our family to use my contacts at the East Empire Company. No, I won't allow it.
You must be using quite a bit of your raw materials repairing their weapons and armor. I'm sorry we can't compensate you.
Just... leave us. Please.
If I don't hear back from you after a while, you're probably dead. Maybe I'll send Talvas out next.
Head back to the mainland, wanderer. There's nothing here but misery.
Your contributions have earned you citizenship here, friend. I'll always consider you one of us.
The Skaal live in harmony with nature and take only what we need from the land.
Once the rest of you are done licking your wounds, of course.
I wish you'd stop acting like I've grown weak.
I don't know. There are many who would've already expected us to leave this place.
You don't have to apologize to me. Just pull yourself out of this and let's find a home. Either here or up there, it doesn't matter to me.
I'm glad to lend a hand.
You're right, my friend. I just grow weary of the struggle.
Second Councilor Adrano can assist you with anything you might need.
Nchardak, an ancient Dwemer city, on the eastern side of Solstheim. It's largely flooded now, but luckily the main library is still above the water.
Want to buy anything, or just laugh at our misfortunes?
I fear to think what would have happened if you hadn't saved me from the elves.
What am I supposed to do until then?
The link is weak, so you'll have to be within about a hundred feet of the source.
No, Councilor. I'm afraid we're going to fall short once again.
Dreyla! I told you I didn't want you seeing him anymore. Must I lock you into the house at night?
Something troubling you? I'd think you'd welcome a little peace and quiet.
Apologies, Adril. In my experience it's usually the quietest before the storm.
Why hasn't a Redoran Guard been posted at my shop like I've requested?
I hear you're the reason Councilor Morvayn's still breathing today. Serves those damn Hlaalu traitors right!
Besides, I'd never work for Neloth! I heard he cut the heart out of his former apprentice.
Attendant, why has the door to the lower level been locked?
You and I both know we can't spare anyone right now. I don't care if you still have friends at the East Empire Company or not.
You refer to the tomes of esoteric knowledge that old Hermaeus Mora has scattered throughout the world?
I tried to talk to you about it, but you just walked away.
Good news, Adril. The next shipment from Windhelm should include the building supplies you requested.
We'll finally be able to begin repairs on The Bulwark. Thank you.
If there's anything else I can do, just let me know.
Head over to the Retching Netch if the ash has your throat parched.
Sure, but then where would you go?
You poor thing. Here you are.
Where do you think? You have to cut it out of a Spriggan.
Glover Mallory is a wonder with the hammer and anvil. He mended my armor like an old pro.
We'll pull through, I promise. Councilor Morvayn would never let us down.
Do I need to go on?
Is it because of your father? Or is it me?
He's never been the same since my mother died. I don't think he ever wants me to feel the pain he suffers.
Don't judge this place. We can make home wherever we are.
What?!
Me? I hardly think so.
I'm sorry. I shouldn't bark at you like that.
You freed us from the dark dream, and for that the Skaal are grateful.
Right then. Let's be off.
You may end up like Miraak, of course. Two power-mad Dragonborn. It could be very interesting.
What in the name of the Black Hands is that supposed to mean?!
I do! Thank you.
Next time you feel like having a conversation, talk to someone else.
I want you to stay away from my daughter!
What now?
It seems you've inherited a situation.
Just a brother. Lives in Riften.
How much longer do you intend to serve as his shield, Adril?
We've got our eyes on you, scale-skin.
Nah. He... finds things people are looking for. Makes a good bit of coin doing it, too.
Councilor Morvayn is the only reason Raven Rock has survived all these years. You should pay your respects.
If you ask me, my father knows how to run things better than the Councilor.
It's a deal.
Well, I hope you'll come back around. Looks like you might be just the thing we need to wake these idiots.
It's much safer for me to risk your life.
Ask my husband. I'm busy.
They seem to have believed this one to be particularly valuable, as it is secured in a mechanism which I have been unable to open. Yet.
You're too good to me, Aphia. I only wish I could remain with you longer.
I'm sorry, I don't carry coin. Perhaps next time.
I don't care if he's a Master Wizard. He can't treat me like this!
Anyway, I don't think he'd take on anyone that isn't a dunmer.
It doesn't matter, my husband. Let's simply cherish the time we have for now.
I'm certain it's only stuck, Elder. I'll speak to Glover Mallory and see if he can take a look at it.
Here, have some food instead.
Oh fine, fine. Here you go.
It doesn't matter, Adril. I'm responsible for those people and I'll make whatever sacrifices are necessary to keep them alive.
I can't believe I've been stuck here this long.
Found one? Yes, and you read it, too, didn't you? Don't try to deny it, you've got the look. I can see it now.
If you witness suspicious activity, report it to Captain Veleth immediately.
Load up, and we'll get underway.
Milore over at the Ienth Farm should be still mixing potions if you're seeking that sort of thing. Far west end of town.
The entire island isn't covered in ash, you know. They have huge ice fields up north and it's freezing up there.
Captain Veleth's mentioned how valuable you've become to the Redoran Guard. The Councilor and I appreciate your assistance.
I've sworn to keep Councilor Morvayn safe, and I intend to take that oath to the grave if need be.
At night, the wind picks up from the ocean and... well, I'm just lucky to keep warm.
Yes, I do. I haven't been able to get it, though. But maybe together we can unlock the secrets the Dwemer left behind.
Seeking passage to Solstheim?
How about a drink for the hero who cleared Fort Frostmoth!
I'll have food ready soon. You need to eat.
See, that wasn't so hard, now was it.
I'm not holding back. If I knew something I wouldn't wait until you strolled in, I'd come find you.
If you're looking for supplies, talk to Fethis. He'll set you up with whatever you need.
If you find yourself in the ash wastes, keep your eyes to the ground. Ash spawn like to spring up from nowhere.
Your coffers are running low, Councilor. At this rate, your treasury will be empty by next winter.
Your contribution to our community will never be forgotten. Azura protect you, serjo.
He doesn't dare try to collect now that I'm Neloth's steward.
You can go where you please, but I'd stay inside the Bulwark if I were you.
May the All-Maker protect us from whatever dark power took control of the Skaal.
Get yourself settled, then.
Besides, Neloth is as loony as a skooma addict. He wanted my father to import a white mammoth. Alive!
We tried to start a new life on the mainland, remember? It was too dangerous. Vvardenfell isn't ready.
I'm not talking about that. I have a knack for smelling trouble, and for some reason you reek of it.
Of course I'm certain.
My men have laid down their lives to keep Raven Rock safe. We've fought too hard to leave. We can't just let it all go.
They just came on so quickly...
Gods. Another mouth to feed? You've picked the wrong town to settle, outlander.
These hands were made for bending steel... not mending bonemold. But, it's certainly better than not working at all.
Then I'll simply have to fall in love with some other senile, grousing old fool.
I can't believe Raven Rock Mine is open again. Finally, something worth defending.
Hmm. I've known for decades that heart stones will animate the ash.
Maybe I won't live as long as the dark elves, but at least I didn't abandon my home.
And what will you do when I'm gone?
Please, I'm starving. Any help will do...
It's good that our people are now free. We can attempt to restore balance to our home.
How about a hundred Dunmer armed to the teeth?
If you're looking to buy, then I'm looking to sell.
The mine's open, people are buying drinks and I'm making money again... just like old times.
I was considering replacing my heart with a heart stone. Fortunately Ildari offered to let me operate on her first.
As one Thieves Guild member to another? Try Drovas over in the Retching Netch.
At least he did until you set him up with that Telvanni wizard. Now he's untouchable.
Very well, cover the difference from my personal treasury.
I have a staff for you, but I would also like to make you a member of my household. A member of House Telvanni.
That's not fair. We can still take it back.
I'm too busy to deal with this right now. Go take them to her.

Then perhaps you do have business here... Forgive me. I'm Rakel, of the Frostmoon Pack. Welcome, sister.

Lun Gron!

Kalafoo!

Baaaa roooka!

What do you need to take?
I'm heading home if you need me.
I'd best get back to Master Neloth then. No telling what's happened since I've been gone.
Yes, Thane. What is it?
The wedding is soon. It'll be a good day.
Fine! I'll take care of it, just please leave me alone!
Look at you. Wearing an Amulet of Mara. Are you saying you're available?
That's a brave offer. I'd be happy to throw in my coin behind that.
Now shouldn't you be off arranging our wedding day? Don't keep me waiting.
Whenever a group of marauders attack a Nord village, Ulfric is the first to sound the horn and send the men.
You've embarrassed the temple and spat in the face of love. What do you want?
Still have something you need?
Take a look.
Is that an Amulet of Mara? I'm surprised someone like you isn't spoken for.
Here, some gold as promised, and let me show you a bit about wearing heavy armor. Save you some aches on a long march.
Right, then.
You're wearing Mara's amulet? You? I'd marry you. I'd marry you twice.
You should speak to the priest in the Temple of Mara to arrange the ceremony. No sense waiting.
I'll see you at our wedding!
I'm looking forward to our wedding. You and me....
Is that Lady Mara's amulet? I'm shocked a fine person like you isn't married already.
Come on. Let's see what you're made of.
Who do you think brought Septimus here? Who do you think protected you on your journey to open the box and loose my knowledge on this world?
Ugh. You mangy piece of pit-bait.
You already appear to have someone with you.
Did you need something?
No problem, I'll handle it.
I'm sorry, that can't be done.
I'm right behind you.
Anything else before you go?
I'm sorry, but I'm not going to do something like that. Even for you.
